titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Banks and John McClure, Indictment
CWG0905

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
William Banks & John McClure
Jefferson Circuit Court,
January Term, A. D. 1864.

The Grand Jurors of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William Banks & John McClure of the Crime of of Grand Larceny committed in manner and form as follows, to=wit: The said Wm Banks & John McClure in the said County of Jefferson on the 10 day of December A. D. 1863 feloniously took & carried away two Boxes of Tobacco ^containing thirty seven pounds of Tobacco^ worth eighty five cents per pound the property of Charles H. Fink against the peace & dignity of the comth of Kentucky, & the said Jurors further present that in said county on said date said William Banks & John McClure did feloniously, knowingly take receive & appropriate to them selves two boxes of tobacco containing thirty seven pounds of Tobacco worth eighty five cents per pound the property of Charles H Fink knowing the same to be stolen contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

A copy
att James P Chambers clk

Witnesses
C. H. Fink
L. S. Reed
N. H. Moore
J. C. Baumberger
Michil Fitzpatrick
D L Bligh

We of the Jury find thd defendants William Banks & John McClure named in the within Indictment, Guilty & say that they each shall be confined in the Jail & Penitentiary of this commonwealth for the term of three years

A copy
att J P Chambers clk

The Comonwealth of Kentucky.
Indictment.
vs } Grand Larceny
William Banks & John McClure
A True Bill.
J B Wilder
Foreman.
1864 Jany 19 Recd from Grand Jury & filed. N G Jr & Jury. Verdict guilty 3 years each.

A copy
att J P Chambers c
